data.title: Cascada - Evacuate The Dance Floor
data.meta_description: Read the story behind the song Evacuate The Dance Floor by Cascada. Join the conversation and submit your own song stories on our site.
data.text:
When Group member Yannou and writer Allan Eshuijs were in the studio they decided to call the song ‘something-something-dancefloor’ they googled the rest of the title and built the story of song around it. In another interview with Digital Spy she explained the title of the song saying: “It’s got a double meaning, totally. Evacuating something can often be about having an illness, but we’ve taken it in the positive way. As the lyrics say, it’s about being infected by the sound and the beat being so cool that it’s just too intense for people.” When singer Natalie was asked about the song, she said: “We have definitely developed the Cascada sound. With ‘Evacuate The Dancefloor’, we’ve taken all we learnt over the last few years and moved on. It’s refreshing and fun. I love R’n’B and I’ve always had a soulful voice. But I didn’t have much opportunity to show that off. This song is more of a challenge for me to sing. I can’t wait to take it to the clubs. People’s jaws are going to hit the floor when they hear it.”

Release Date:

June 29, 2009

Songwriter/s:

Manuel Reuter – Yann Peifer – Allan Eshuijs

Label: All Around the world – Universal TV

Chart Rankings:

US – 25

UK – 1

Germany – 5

In the UK, ‘Evacuate the dancefloor’ topped the Official Charts Company selling over 400.000 copies. The British Phonographic Industry (BPI) certified it Gold. In the US, it peaked at number 25 on the Billboard Hot 100 but topped the US Dance/Mix Show Airplay. The Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA) certified it Platinum for sales over 1 million copies. The song reached the top 10 in several countries including Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, France, Germany, Hungary, Ireland, Luxembourg, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Scotland, Slovakia and Switzerland. It was certified Double Platinum in Canada, Platinum in Australia and New Zealand.

Artist’s age on Release Date:

Cascada band was active for 5 years when they released this song.

Cover Versions:

Very few amateur artists covered this song on Youtube.
